It was wielded to end a war in a single night, and the peace that followed was worse than the war.
A saint attempted to cleanse it; the saint’s name was erased from all records the next day.
A king wore it during a coronation and died before the crown touched their head.
It disappeared from a museum after every guard reported the same dream.
A wizard used it to bargain with a dragon; both parties claim they won, and both are lying.
A village kept it as a good-luck charm—until the harvest began to whisper secrets.
It was broken into pieces; each shard began generating its own legends.
